text: I Updated to Julia 1.6.  In 1.5.3 I was using the environment variable ssl_cert_file with a .pem file to get through a company firewall.  For 1.6 I have deleted this env variable and set the env variable julia_ssl_ca_roots_path = “”.  That gets at the registry but the artifacts like Qt and others for plots can’t get automatically installed.  How do I debug/fix this?   Thanks for the help Julia gurus!

elements.text: I Updated to Julia 1.6.  In 1.5.3 I was using the environment variable ssl_cert_file with a .pem file to get through a company firewall.  For 1.6 I have deleted this env variable and set the env variable julia_ssl_ca_roots_path = “”.  That gets at the registry but the artifacts like Qt and others for plots can’t get automatically installed.  How do I debug/fix this?   Thanks for the help Julia gurus!

text: shouldn't `JULIA_SSL_CA_ROOTS_PATH` be set to the path pointing to your .pem, not the empty path?

elements.text: be set to the path pointing to your .pem, not the empty path?

text: I can try that.  Also, when the old system used curl.  I needed to add a _curlrc with “insecure” keyword in it to make things work.  That is still in my home directory.

elements.text: I can try that.  Also, when the old system used curl.  I needed to add a _curlrc with “insecure” keyword in it to make things work.  That is still in my home directory.

text: The environment variable above did not matter.

elements.text: The environment variable above did not matter.

text: what did you set it to?

elements.text: what did you set it to?

text: according to <https://julialang.org/blog/2021/03/julia-1.6-highlights/#downloads_networkingoptions>, that ENV variable should point to the .pem
